column4: hello all.  ahve a question for you.  just rendered my os (vista) unusable.  I enlarged the partition, then could't boot from it.  i've tried everything.  and my question is, if i install vista on another partition (install it again), will I be able to browse my primary partition from there, transfer my data to my new vista os, and save the day?
is your vista partition also your primary partition?
did you back up before resizing the partition?
of course not.  otherwise i wouldn't be here in the forum
what was your setup prior to repartitioning?
what's the best way to recover my data?  i tried the data recovery progs on hiren, but they ll seem very time consuming and confusing.
i tried the vista recovery tools, didn't work.  tried to rebuild mbr, that didn't work.  tried to use hiren, that didn't fix it.
sorry. i had a similar problem in november and wasn't able to recover anything. :(
ubuntu-vista dual boot.  then i resized vista (enlarged it.  then I reinstalled ubuntu.  now, my computer won't boot to anything.  nothing loads.
if you repartitioned and did an install after the partition, you may have overwritten the files.
but my vista os, still shows up as an os.  i didn't overwrite the files at all.  they are all still there, I am sure of it.  it's just that my os won't load for some reason.
that's in my dad's room.  it's too early to go in there.  7:00am or so here.... :)
hurm. live cd is the best bet. wish i could give you better advice. it's so frustrating dealing with potential data loss.
no prob.  Thanks a lot man.
